pull.title: refactor: remove superfluous boost::thread_interrupted catch
pull.body: No point in catching exception just to re-throw it

events.body: Please don't mark non-doc code changes trivial.
Couldn't find a better category. What do you suggest?
@hmel You can use `refactor:`. Please squash the commits and update commit message.

rename.to: WIP: refactor: remove superfluous boost::thread_interrupted catch

rename.from: WIP: refactor: remove superfluous boost::thread_interrupted catch

events.body: NACK 1757d88 these catches are not superfluous

comments.body: The catch above is to give special treatment to `boost::thread_interrupted`, relative to the `std::exception` catch that follows. It's a way of excluding these from the `std::exception` treatment.
